text: I think it boils down to Zygote doesn't really understand constructors well

but <@U6PQP41C3> is super busy this week.

elements.text: had to do a bunch of this for Hankel.jl i think?

text: I've never understood why Zygote has this issue. In Hankel.jl, the only worrying constructor was one that computed constants needed to perform the Hankel transform. In principle, a user might want to AD that constructor, but it would probably be rare, so I just made it non-differentiable to prevent Zygote from erroring.

elements.text: I've never understood why Zygote has this issue. In Hankel.jl, the only worrying constructor was one that computed constants needed to perform the Hankel transform. In principle, a user might want to AD that constructor, but it would probably be rare, so I just made it non-differentiable to prevent Zygote from erroring.
